questions.question: Which view is the default view in MS Word that shows the document exactly as it will look when printed?
questions.explanation: Print Layout is the standard view that displays margins, headers, footers, and page breaks as they will appear on paper.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'Immersive Reader' found in the View tab?
options: To customize the reading experience for better focus and accessibility (e.g., Read Aloud, Line Focus)
To translate the document into binary
questions.explanation: Immersive Reader uses AI to improve reading comprehension by offering tools like text-to-speech, line isolation, and spacing adjustments.

questions.question: Which command allows you to view two different parts of the *same* document at the same time?
questions.explanation: The 'Split' command divides the current window horizontally, allowing you to scroll through two different sections of the same file independently.

questions.question: What is a 'Macro' in MS Word?
options: A recorded series of commands and instructions that you group together as a single command to automate a task
questions.explanation: Macros allow users to record a sequence of clicks and keystrokes to automate repetitive tasks.

questions.question: Which function key is the universal shortcut to open the 'Help' pane in Microsoft Office applications?
questions.explanation: F1 is the standard shortcut key to open the Help window in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

questions.question: In the 'Show' group, which option would you check to see the horizontal and vertical measuring tools along the edges of your document?
questions.explanation: The Ruler option toggles the display of the measurement bars used for setting tabs, indents, and margins.

questions.question: If you want to read a document like a book, flipping pages horizontally instead of scrolling down, which Page Movement option should you choose?
questions.explanation: Side-to-Side page movement mimics a book, allowing you to slide pages horizontally.

questions.question: Which View mode removes almost all interface elements (ribbons/toolbars) to maximize the reading area?
questions.explanation: Read Mode optimizes the screen for reading by hiding editing tools and adjusting the layout.

questions.question: What happens if you click 'Page Width' in the Zoom group?
options: The document zoom is adjusted so the width of the page fills the screen
questions.explanation: Page Width zooms the document in or out so that the left and right edges of the paper match the width of your window.

questions.question: The 'Navigation Pane' helps you to:
options: Quickly move between Headings, Pages, or search results within the document
questions.explanation: The Navigation Pane provides a sidebar to jump to specific headings, pages, or search terms found in the document.

questions.question: Which view is most useful for seeing the structure of a document and moving whole sections (Headings) around easily?
questions.explanation: Outline View displays the document as a hierarchy of headings, making it easy to collapse, expand, and reorganize sections.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Switch Windows' command?
options: To toggle between multiple open Word documents
questions.explanation: Switch Windows provides a list of currently open Word files so you can quickly jump from one to another.

questions.question: In 'Web Layout' view, how does the document appear?
options: As one continuous page without page breaks, similar to a webpage
questions.explanation: Web Layout simulates how the document would look if saved as a web page, wrapping text to the window size with no page breaks.

questions.question: The 'Arrange All' button in the Window group allows you to:
options: Stack all open Word windows on the screen so you can see them all at once
questions.explanation: Arrange All tiles all open Word windows horizontally or vertically so they are all visible simultaneously.

questions.question: Which Zoom option would you select to see the whole page (top to bottom) on your screen at once?
questions.explanation: The 'One Page' zoom setting fits the entire height and width of a single page into the current window.

questions.question: If you want to view gridlines on your document to help align objects, which group in the View tab should you look in?
questions.explanation: Gridlines are toggled via a checkbox in the 'Show' group.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a feature found in the Help Tab?
questions.explanation: Insert Video is located in the Insert Tab, not the Help Tab.

questions.question: When using 'Record Macro', where can you assign the macro for quick access?
options: To a Button (Quick Access Toolbar) or a Keyboard Shortcut
questions.explanation: When creating a macro, Word asks if you want to assign it to a Button or a Keyboard Shortcut.

questions.question: Draft View is best used for:
options: Quick editing of text without distractions like headers, footers, or images
questions.explanation: Draft view simplifies the layout to focus purely on text entry and editing, hiding layout elements.

questions.question: The 'Synchronous Scrolling' feature (available when viewing Side by Side) ensures that:
options: You scroll one document and the other scrolls automatically with it
Both documents save at the same time
questions.explanation: Synchronous Scrolling locks the scroll bars of two side-by-side documents so they move together for easy comparison.
